column1: == Geography ==

Ongole is located at 15.5°N 80.05°E. It has an average elevation of 10 m (33 ft) AMSL and is situated on the plains. The city is around 15.54miles (25 km) to the west of the Bay of Bengal on the east coast of India.

column1: == Economy ==
Agriculture is the primary industry of Ongole
column2: and the city is a major center for tobacco trading in Andhra Pradesh.

column1: Export of oxen
Ongole bulls are a breed of oxen that are exported to many countries. The Brahman bull in America is an off-breed of the Ongole. Ongole Island
column3: holds many Ongole oxen. The population of Ongole off-breed animals in Brazil is said to be around several millions. The original breed of Ongole stud bulls are found in a small region around Ongole town between the Gundlakamma and Musi Rivers.

column1: == Transport ==
The city is connected by road to major destinations. National Highway 16
column2: a part of Golden Quadrilateral highway network
column3: bypasses the city. National Highway 216 connects the city with Kathipudi. The city has a total road length of 738.50 km. Ongole bus station is owned and operated by Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation. The station is also equipped with a bus depot for storage and maintenance of buses. The Passengers delight project was implemented at the bus station for improving cleanliness and modernizing it. Ongole railway station is categorized as a Non-Subruban Grade-3 (NSG-3) station in the Vijayawada railway division.
